conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the frictional force exerted by the ground on the long wooden board ab by considering forces and applying principles of friction.
The wooden block P of mass m is sliding on the wooden board ab.
The wooden board ab of mass M is in contact with the ground.
There are two frictional forces to consider: friction between block P and board ab with coefficient μ2, and friction between board ab and ground with coefficient μ1.
The normal force exerted by the board ab on the block P is equal to the weight of the block, N1 = mg.
The normal force exerted by the ground on the board ab is equal to the combined weight of the block and the board, N2 = (m + M)g.
The frictional force f1 between the block P and the board ab is f1 = μ2 * mg.
The frictional force f2 between the board ab and the ground is f2 = μ1 * (m + M)g.
The board ab remains stationary, implying the net force acting on it is zero.
The frictional force f1 exerted by the block P on the board ab is counteracted by the frictional force f2 exerted by the ground on the board ab.
Since the board ab is stationary, f2 = f1, so the magnitude of the frictional force exerted by the ground is f2 = μ2 * mg.
The magnitude of the frictional force exerted by the ground on the long wooden board ab is μ2 * mg.
